DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure C-Reactive Protein Result Integer::1 Decimal Place Milligram per Deciliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place milligram per deciliter numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of C-reactive protein in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for C-reactive protein, encoded by the CRP gene this protein is cleaved during biological activation and is associated with host defense mechanisms and inflammatory responses.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: C-reactive protein [precursor] (224 aa, ~25 kDa) is encoded by the CRP gene. This protein is cleaved during biological activation and is associated with host defense mechanisms and inflammatory responses.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: C-reactive protein (224 aa, ~25 kDa) is encoded by the human CRP gene. This protein is cleaved during biological activation and is associated with host defense mechanisms and inflammatory responses.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome 1 Decimal Place Milligram per Deciliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Milligram per Deciliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
